benchmark_details.name: Unlearning as Ablation: Toward a Falsifiable Benchmark for Generative Scientific Discovery
benchmark_details.overview: This paper proposes unlearning-as-ablation as a falsifiable probe of constructive scientific discovery. It focuses on testing whether large language models (LLMs) can derive new results after systematically removing prior knowledge associated with those results.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a methodology for testing the limits of LLMs in generative scientific discovery.

methodology.calculation: Calculation of success is based on whether the model can re-derive knowledge post unlearning.
methodology.interpretation: Success indicates ability to generate knowledge; failure indicates dependence on memorized fragments.
